title: The One Where the Monkey Gets Away

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica enters with some mail.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mail call, Rachel Green, bunk seven.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you. (Examines it) Oh, cool! Free sample of coffee!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh good! 'Cause where else would we get any?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Right. ...Oh great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Country club newsletter. My mother sends me the engagement notices for 'inspiration.' Oh my God! Oh my God, it's Barry and Mindy!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Barry who you almost...?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Barry who I almost.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And Mindy, your maid of...?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mindy, my maid of. Oh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Takes it) That's Mindy? Wow, she is pretty. (Sees Rachel's look) Lucky. To have had a friend like you.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica enters with some mail.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are eating Chinese.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel. Bring me the rice, c'mon. Bring me the rice, c'mon. Good boy. Good boy. C'mere, gimme the rice. (Marcel brings the rice) Thank you, good boy. Well, I see he's finally mastered the difference between 'bring me the' and 'pee in the'. (Rachel ignores him) 'Bring me the' and- Rach?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Oh, this is so stupid! I mean, I gave Barry up, right? I should be happy for them! I am, I'm happy for them.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Really.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. Oh, oh, I guess it would be different if I were- with somebody.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoah, uh, what happened to, uh, 'Forget relationships! I'm done with men!' The whole, uh, penis embargo?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't know. I guess it's not about no guys, it's about the right guy, y'know? I mean, with Barry, it was safe and it was easy, but there was no heat. With Paolo, that's all there was, was heat! And it was just this raw, animal, sexual...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait-wait. I, I got it. I was there.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I mean, do you think you can ever have both? Y'know? Someone who's like, who's like your best friend, but then also can make your toes curl?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes. Yes. Yes! Yes, I really do! In fact, it's funny, very often, someone who you wouldn't think could-could curl your toes, might just be the one who...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...Gets interrupted. Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, how was the movie?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wonderful!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So good!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Suck-fest.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Toootal chick-flick.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I-I'm sorry it wasn't one of those movies with, like, y'know, guns and bombs and, like, buses going really fast...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, I don't need violence to enjoy a movie. Just so long as there's a little nudity.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: There was nudity!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I meant female nudity. Alright? I don't need to see Lou Grant frolicking.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hugh! Hugh Grant!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, I've gotta go. C'mon, Marcel! C'mon! We're gonna go take a bath. Yes we are, aren't we? Yes, we are.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: They're still just friends, right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (To Marcel) And I will see you tomorrow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's right, you're gonna spend tomorrow at Aunt Rachel's, aren't you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, hang on, hang on. Does Aunt Monica get a say in this?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'Pwease, Aunt Monica, pwease?' Oh, unclench. You're not even gonna be there.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are eating Chinese.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joe-G's Pizza, the guys are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't believe we are even having this discussion.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I agree. I'm, like, in disbelief.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I mean, don't you think if things were gonna happen with Rachel, they would've happened already?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, she said she's looking for a relationship with someone exactly like me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She really said that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I added the 'exactly like me' part... But she said she's looking for someone, and someone is gonna be there tonight.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: 'Tonight' tonight?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I think it's perfect. Y'know, it's just gonna be the two of us, she spent all day taking care of my monkey...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't remember the last time I got a girl to take care of my monkey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyway, I figured after work I'd go pick up a bottle of wine, go over there and, uh, try to woo her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, y'know what you should do? You should take her back to the 1890's, when that phrase was last used.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Joe-G's Pizza, the guys are there.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is taking care of Marcel and they are watching a
soap opera.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Now, now the one in the feather boa, that's Dr. Francis. Now, she used to be a man. Okay, now look, see, there's Raven. We hate her. We're glad she's dying. Okay- (Marcel pushes down a cushion to reveal a shoe) Wh- wh- Marcel, are you playing with Monica's shoes? You know you're not supposed to pl- whoah. Marcel, did you poo in the shoe? (Takes the shoe into the kitchen) Marcel, bad monkey! Oh! Oh! (She notices the newsletter and taps the contents of the shoes onto it, then folds it shut) Sorry, Barry. Little engagement gift. I'm sure you didn't register for that. (She leaves the apartment holding the newsletter at arm's length. However, she leaves the door open. Marcel runs out in the opposite direction. There is a shot from the TV and Rachel runs back in) Who died? Who died? Roll him over! Oh, c'mon, roll him over! Oh...! Well, we know it wasn't Dexter, right Marcel? Because- (Looks down and notices he is missing) Marcel? Marc- (Notices the open door)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How could you lose him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know. We were watching TV, and then he pooped in Monica's shoe-

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wait. He pooped in my shoe? Which one?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know. The left one.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Which ones ?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Oh, those little clunky Amish things you think go with everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whoah, ooh, why is the air in here so negative?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Rachel lost Marcel.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no, how?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He- he pooped in my shoe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Which one?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Those cute little black ones I wear all the time.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, which one ? The right or left? 'Cause the left one is lucky...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: C'mon, you guys, what're we gonna do, what're we gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright alright. You're a monkey. You're loose in the city. Where do you go?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, it's his first time out, so he's probably gonna wanna do some of the touristy things. I'll go to Cats , you go to the Russian Tea Room .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, my, God, c'mon, you guys! He's gonna be home any minute! He's gonna kill me!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, we'll start with the building. You guys take the first and second floor, Phoebe and I'll take third and fourth.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, what'm I gonna do? What'm I gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, you stay here, and just wait by the phone. Spray Lysol in my shoe, and wait for Ross to kill you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Anybody wanna trade? Oh...

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Whaddyou want?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mr. Heckles, our friend lost a monkey. Have you seen it?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I left a Belgian waffle out here, did you take it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why would you leave your Belgian waffle in the hall?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I wasn't ready for it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: A monkey. Have you seen a monkey?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Saw Regis Philbin once...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, thank you, Mr. Heckles. (They move off)

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: You owe me a waffle.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (On the phone) Okay, he's a, he's a black capuchian monkey with a white face... (Enter Ross) ...with, with Russian dressing and, and pickles on the side. Okay. Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey. How did, uh, how'd it go today?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Great! It went great. Really great. Hey, is that wine?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. You, uh, you want some?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I would love some. But y'know what? Y'know what? Let's not drink it here. I'm feeling kinda crazy. You wanna go to Newark?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, okay, yeah, we could do that, but before we head off to the murder capital of the North-East, I was, uh, kinda wanting to run something by you. Y'know how we were, uh, y'know, talking before about, uh, relationships and stuff? (Uncorks the wine) Well-

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, Ross, I cannot do this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, quick and painful. (Starts to cork the wine)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God... Okay. Alright. Alright. Okay. Ross, please don't hate me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, what? What-what?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I kind of... I kind of lost him.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is taking care of Marcel and they are watching a
soap opera.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Angry) I- I- I ca- I can't believe this. I mean, all I asked you to do was keep him in the apartment.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know, I know, I'm sorry-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, y'know what, I guess it's partially my fault. Y'know, I shouldn't've, uh, asked you to start off with a monkey. I should've started you off with like a pen or a pencil.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Tearfully) Ross, I'm doing everything that I can, I've got everybody looking for him, and I- (Door buzzer goes and she runs to get it) Oh! Who is it?

dialogue.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogue.text: Animal Control.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: See? I've even called Animal Control!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You called Animal Control?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh-huh... why... do you not like them?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel is an illegal exotic animal. I'm not allowed to have him in the city. If they find him, they'll take him away from me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: O-okay, now see, you never ever ever told us that...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's right, I.. 'cause I didn't expect you were gonna invite them to the apartment!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, thanks for coming.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: (Animal Control) Somebody called about a monkey?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, y'know what? That was a complete misunderstanding! (Ross puts his arms around her and they act all sweetness and light)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, we thought we had a monkey, but we-we didn't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Turned out it was a hat.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Cat!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Cat! What'm I saying? Cat!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi. We checked the third and fourth floor, no-one's seen Marcel.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My uncle Marcel.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, is that who the monkey's named after?

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Oookay. Are you aware that possession of an illegal exotic is, uh, punishable by up to two years in prison and confiscation of the animal?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God. You'd put that poor little creature in jail?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pheebs, you remember how we talked about saying things quietly to yourself first?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, but there isn't always time!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look. I'm sure there's some friendly way to reconcile this! Um, have a seat. First of all, we haven't been introduced, I'm Monica Geller.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Oh my God, you are! And you're Rachel Green!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Luisa Gianetti! Lincoln High? I sat behind you guys in home room!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Luisa? Oh my God! Monica! It's Luisa!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: The Luisa from home room!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes!!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: You have no idea who I am, do you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, none at all.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: None.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Well, maybe that's because you spent four years ignoring me. I mean, would it have been so hard to say 'Morning, Luisa'? Or 'Nice overalls'?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm- I'm so sorry!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Ah, it's not so much you, you were fat, you had your own problems. (To Rachel) But you? What a bitch !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, d'you think you could just help us out here on that monkey thing? Y'know, just for old times' sake? Go Bobcats?

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: I could... but I won't. If I find that monkey, he's mine. (Leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Dun-dun-duuuur! Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Um, we're kind of having an emergency and we-we were looking for something...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: A monkey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes have you seen any?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Um, sure! Did you, uh, did you try turning the knob back the other way?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh. Then, no.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, nononowaitwaitwaitnono! Uh... we may not know anything about radiators per se, but we do have a certain amount of expertise in the heating and cooling... mileu.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, aren't we kind of in the middle of something here?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, but these women are very hot, and they need our help! And they're very hot.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We can't, alright? (To the women) We're sorry. You have no idea how sorry, but... We promised we'd find this monkey. If you see him, he's about yea high and answers to the name Marcel, so if we could get some pictures of you, you'd really be helping us out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, from now on, you don't get to talk to other people.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Marcel?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: BOTH
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh-my-God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Whaaat!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Something just brushed up against my right leg!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's okay, it was just my left leg.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, Phoebe!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah! Oh, c'mere, Marcel! Oh, Marcel, c'mere!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Step aside, ladies! (She loads a gun)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Just a small tranquiliser.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Run, Marcel, run! Run, Marcel! (Marcel runs off and Luisa runs after him. Monica goes to check up on Phoebe) Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, think so. Oh! (She notices the tranquiliser dart has hit her in the butt and removes it) Huh. (Sways back) Whoah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh gosh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marc- oh, this is ridiculous! We've been all over the neighbourhood. He's gone, he's-he's just gone.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you don't know that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh come on. It's cold, it's dark, he doesn't know the Village. (Kicks a sign in frustration) And now I have a broken foot. I have no monkey, and a broken foot! Thank you very much.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, I said I'm sorry like a million times. What do you want me to do? You want me to break my foot too? Okay, I'm gonna break my foot, right here. (Kicks the sign) Ow!! Oh! Oh my God, oh my God! There, are you happy now?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. Y'know, now that you kicked the sign, hey! I don't miss Marcel any more!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, it is not like I did this on purpose.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, no no no. Nono, this is just vintage Rachel. I mean, things just sort of happen around you. I mean, you're off in Rachel-land, doing your Rachel-thing, totally oblivious to people's monkeys, or to people's feelings...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't even wanna hear it, you're just...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, forget it, okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? What?

dialogue.speaker: BOTH
dialogue.text: Hey! Hey, Bananaman!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, this is so intense. One side of my butt is totally asleep, and the other side has no idea.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi, did you order some bananas?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: What about it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Gimme back my monkey.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I don't have a monkey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then what's with all the bananas?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Potassium.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel? Marcel? Okay, where is he? Where is he? Marcel? Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel! What've you done to him?

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: That's my monkey. That's Patti, Patti the monkey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you insane? C'mere, Marcel, c'mon. (Marcel starts to go to him)

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: C'mere, Patti. (Marcel turns round)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mere, Marcel. (Turns to Ross)

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: C'mere, Patti. (Turns to Mr. Heckles)

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: (Out of shot) Here, monkey. Here, monkey! Here, monkey! (Marcel runs to the door and into Luisa's cage, which she slams shut) Gotcha.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, gimme my monkey back.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: That's my monkey.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: You're both gonna have to take this up with the judge.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: That's not my monkey. Just the dress is mine, you can send that back whenever.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, I want my monkey.

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, c'mon, Luisa!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Sorry, prom queen.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (To Rachel) You had to be a bitch in high school, you couldn't've been fat.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright. In high school I was the prom queen and I was the homecoming queen and the class president and you... were also there! But if you take this monkey, I will lose one of the most important people in my life. You can hate me if you want, but please do not punish him. C'mon, Luisa, you have a chance to be the bigger person here! Take it!

dialogue.speaker: LUISA
dialogue.text: Nope.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright. Well then how about I call your supervisor, and I tell her that you shot my friend in the ass with a dart?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Rachel and Ross are there. Ross is trying to get the dress
off Marcel.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It'll be nice to get this off finally, won't it? Yes it will. (Marcel resists) Or we can leave it on for now, that's fine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, with the right pair of pumps, that would be a great little outfit.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen, I'm- I'm sorry I was so hard on you before, it's just I...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Ross, c'mon. It's my fault, I almost lost your...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, but you were the one who got him back, y'know? You, you were great. ...Hey, we uh, we still have that, uh, that bottle of wine. You in the mood for, uh, something grape?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That'd be good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright. (He goes to get the glasses. Then he hesitates and turns off the main light. Rachel looks round and he acts surprised) The, uh, the neighbours must be vacuuming. (He sits down and starts to pour the wine) Well, so long as we're here and, uh, not on the subject, I was thinking about, uh, how mad we got at each other before, and, um, I was thinking maybe it was partially because of how we, um...

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Barry?!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: I can't. I can't do it, I can't marry Mindy. I think I'm still in love with you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We have got to start locking that door!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Rachel and Ross are there. Ross is trying to get the dress
off Marcel.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Joey, Phoebe, and Chandler are looking through Monica's
high school yearbook]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This is me in The Sound of Music . See the von Trapp kids?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nope.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's because I'm in front of them.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Eh. I thought that was an alp.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, high school was not my favourite time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I dunno, I loved high school. Y'know? It was just four years of parties and dating and sex.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well I went to boarding school with four hundred boys. Any sex I had would've involved a major lifestyle choice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Gosh, doesn't it seem like a million years ago?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh. Oooh! Ooh! Ooh! (She stands up and starts to dance around) Ooh! My butt cheek is waking up! Oooh! Ooh!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Joey, Phoebe, and Chandler are looking through Monica's
high school yearbook]
